intro: Aethionema minus, commonly known as the small rockcress, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the rocky areas of the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with four-petaled flowers. The plant typically has basal leaves that are linear to oblanceolate in shape, and its flowers are small, yellow, and borne in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Aethionema minus is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to tolerate harsh environmental conditions.
